intro: Loeflingia saharae, commonly known as the Sahara loeflingia, is a rare and unique plant native to the arid regions of the Sahara Desert. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescence. The plant has adapted to extreme desert conditions with thick, waxy leaves that reduce water loss. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during brief periods of rainfall. Due to its limited distribution and fragile ecosystem, it is considered a vulnerable species.
